New Records: Nikola Jokic recorded a triple-double with 30 points, 14 assists, and 11 rebounds, marking his fifth triple-double of the season.
Jamal Murray became the first player in Nuggets franchise history to make 1,000 career 3-pointers.
Key Match Events: The Nuggets scored 40 points in the first quarter, making 14 out of 20 shots, and built a 17-6 lead early in the game.
Denver extended its lead to 86-64 by outscoring the Heat 15-4 in the opening 3:03 of the third quarter.
The Heat struggled without Jimmy Butler, who left the game early due to an ankle injury.
Pre-Game Insights: Jamal Murray's return after missing three games with a concussion was a key factor for the Nuggets.
The Nuggets were expected to face challenges from the Heat, especially without Jimmy Butler.
Post-Match Reflections: The Nuggets continued their recent surge with a sixth win in the past seven games after an 0-2 start.
Jamal Murray's return and strong performance were pivotal in the victory.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Russell Westbrook dished out a season-high 10 assists for Denver.
The game was followed by notes on upcoming matches for both teams.
